meanings.sent1: She is the squabbiest person in our group, always starting arguments over small things.
meanings.sent2: The squabbiest siblings in the neighborhood were known for their constant bickering.
meanings.sent3: The squabbiest ducks in the pond fought over the last piece of bread.
meanings.sent4: The squabbiest clouds in the sky seemed to argue about who would rain first.
meanings.sent5: The squabbiest cat in the house hissed at every little movement, ready to pick a fight.

meanings.definition: Squabbiest (adverb): in a manner characterized by petty arguments or disputes
meanings.sent1: They always spoke squabbiest, never agreeing on anything without a fight.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors argued squabbiest over the property line, never reaching a resolution.
meanings.sent3: The children played squabbiest, each wanting to be the leader of the game.
meanings.sent4: The politicians debated squabbiest, trying to score points rather than find solutions.
meanings.sent5: The siblings competed squabbiest in the annual family game night, each wanting to win at all costs.

meanings.definition: Squabbiest (noun): the person or thing that is the most prone to quarrels or disputes
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, he was known as the squabbiest, always getting into arguments with classmates.
meanings.sent2: The squabbiest of the group was the one who initiated conflicts over trivial matters.
meanings.sent3: The squabbiest of the vegetables in the garden was the zucchini, always fighting for sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Among the animals, the squabbiest was the raccoon, known for its territorial disputes.
meanings.sent5: The squabbiest tree in the forest was the oak, constantly competing for space and resources with other plants.
